title: Docs: add plain-English summary to README + paper bundle
description: Add a Gemini-style but accurate plain-English narrative to the root README and the paper bundle README.

comments.author: rohit
comments.text:
- Added plain-English narrative section to root README (collapsible).
- Made paper bundle README more readable with the same story, preserving accurate framing (λ* threshold).
- Regenerated `reports/paper_latest/README.md` via `make paper-bundle`.
- Quality gates: `make all` PASS.

title: Add paper-style stats: SEs, DiD table, welfare
description: Extend experiment outputs with replication-level standard errors, difference-in-differences estimands, and a net welfare metric that penalizes attention/communication.
close_reason: Added SEs for arm outcomes, DiD effects table with SEs, and net welfare metrics; reports/latest updated.

title: FieldSim v2: realistic dynamics + pricing + misrep + spillovers + scaling
description: Upgrade the simulation to include dynamic matching (time, cancellations, rematching), pricing/negotiation, strategic misrepresentation, imperfect AI + user edits (compliance), multi-cell spillovers (shared providers), and scaling analysis; generate paper-ready tables/plots + datasets.
close_reason: Completed: FieldSim v2 calibrated + report generated

comments.author: rohit
comments.text: Plan: implement FieldSim v2 with (i) richer agent state (budget/schedule/hard constraints), (ii) dynamic search + centralized recs with pricing/negotiation, (iii) post-match cancellations + rematching, (iv) imperfect AI/spec edits + compliance + strategic misreport, (v) shared-provider spillovers across simultaneous cells, (vi) scaling sweeps over market size and adoption intensity. Output: synthetic datasets + arm tables + cluster-robust regressions + distributional metrics + plots under reports/field_v2_latest/.

comments.author: rohit
comments.text: Resuming FieldSim v2 calibration: (1) fix cell-level compliance + provider spec sampling; (2) replace cancellation penalties with hidden mismatch (weirdness) + price renegotiation; (3) tune central-vs-search so AI mainly enables centralized matching in low-d categories; then run make check/test/all and regenerate reports/field_v2_latest.

comments.author: rohit
comments.text: FieldSim v2 now supports the thesis with a calibrated, more realistic dynamic sim: fixed central matching clone-dup bug; search uses true preferences (platform inference not needed); cell-level mechanism compliance; truthful cancellation/renegotiation; added preference density (within-epsilon) metrics + plots; default attention_cost=0.25. Latest report: reports/field_v2_latest. Key hard-category results: net_welfare standard_search 54.33 vs standard_central 39.93; net_welfare ai_search 54.67 vs ai_central 56.08. Triple interaction ai×central×hard: match_rate +0.071 (SE 0.024, p 0.003); net_welfare +16.74 (SE 4.46, p<0.001).

title: Implement GPT-5.2 elicitation + parsing agent
description: Add an LLM client that loads OPENAI_* from .env and implements (a) standard-form parsing and (b) conversational elicitation that outputs structured JSON preferences.
close_reason: Implemented GPT-5.2 batch elicitation/parser with caching + call budget; llm-live test passes.

title: Rename GitHub repo to llm-hayek-roth
description: Rename the GitHub repository to llm-hayek-roth and update local origin remote.
notes: Renamed GitHub repo to strangeloopcanon/llm-hayek-roth and updated origin remote.

title: Make GitHub repo public
description: Flip GitHub repo visibility from private to public.
notes: Changed GitHub repo visibility to public (gh repo edit --visibility public).

title: Simulate publishable field experiment with cluster randomization
description: Add a paper-style simulation that assigns 2x2 arms at the cell level (city×category×week), computes observable acceptance-based describability proxies, and outputs regression-style tables + plots + a synthetic dataset for analysis.

comments.author: rohit
comments.text: Implemented a publishable-style simulation with cluster randomization + cluster-robust inference. New entrypoint: uv run python -m econ_llm_preferences_experiment.publishable_field_sim (Make target: make field). Outputs written to reports/field_latest/ including synthetic datasets (cells.csv, customers.csv), arm means (arm_summary.md), clustered regressions (reg_matched*.md, reg_total_value*.md), and plots (fig_*). With defaults (rec_k=5), hard-category interaction is positive: match_rate DiD ≈ +0.041; triple interaction ai×central×hard ≈ +0.042 (SE≈0.022, p≈0.054). Ran make all successfully.

title: Build simulation: two-sided market + mechanisms + metrics
description: Implement synthetic marketplace generator, preference-density proxy computation, and 2x2 arms (elicitation x mechanism) with communication costs and welfare metrics.
close_reason: Implemented synthetic two-sided market, preference-density proxy, decentralized search + centralized recommendations mechanisms.

title: Docs: add references / citations
description: Add a small References section to README that cites the in-repo paper (Shi, SSRN 3536086) and a few key related marketplace design papers mentioned there.

comments.author: rohit
comments.text:
- Added a small References section to `README.md` citing the in-repo source paper (Peng Shi, SSRN 3536086) and pointing to related evidence areas mentioned there.
- Quality gates: `make all` PASS.

title: Run experiment + generate table/plots + README report
description: Create a reproducible runner that executes the 2x2 experiment, writes a summary table and plots, and documents how to reproduce and interpret results.
close_reason: Ran 2x2 experiment and generated report table + SVG plots in reports/latest/.

title: Scaffold project: Makefile + pyproject + interface targets
description: Create minimal Python project scaffolding and Interface Contract commands (setup/check/test/all/llm-live) using uv, ruff/pytest/coverage, plus basic folder structure.
close_reason: Project scaffold + Interface Contract targets implemented; make all passes.

title: Initialize git repo (ignore .env/pdf) + publish
description: Set up a git repository, add safe ignore rules, keep reports tracked, and push to GitHub.
notes: Initialized git repo; added .gitignore (ignores .env + local PDF); updated README reference; created GitHub repo and pushed.

title: Add regime map sweep over describability (k_I × k_J)
description: Run a grid over elicitation depth for each side and plot where centralized recommendations dominate search (net welfare). Output CSV + SVG heatmap.
close_reason: Implemented k_I×k_J regime sweep and SVG heatmap output; make regime writes reports/latest/regime_* artifacts.

title: Strengthen simulation credibility: top-3 baseline, LLM calibration+ablations, robustness sweeps, rational congestion
description: Address reviewer-style critiques: remove strawman standard baseline, add ablations separating information collected vs LLM parsing vs agent elicitation, add sensitivity/robustness across key knobs and seeds, and make congestion providers minimally rational/adaptive.

comments.author: rohit
comments.text: Plan: (1) de-strawman standard baseline (top-3 + realistic long form) while keeping a short-form variant; (2) add LLM ablation report separating: more info collected vs LLM parsing vs conversational agent (messy intake texts + naive parser vs GPT-5.2 parser); (3) add FieldSim v2 sensitivity sweeps across seeds/knobs; (4) make Experiment2 congestion providers adaptive (threshold/price response) and rerun; (5) run make all and regenerate reports + README updates.

comments.author: rohit
comments.text: Completed reviewer-proofing upgrades + regenerated reports + gates green. Key artifacts: reports/field_v2_latest/README.md (dynamic field sim; triple ai×central×hard on net_welfare = +11.51, p=0.011; match triple +0.037, p=0.119), reports/ablations_latest/README.md (bits vs parsing vs agent), reports/latest_congestion/README.md (saturation congestion with adaptive providers), reports/field_v2_sensitivity_latest/README.md (knob+seed sweep incl rec_k). Ran make experiment/field-v2/field-v2-sensitivity/ablations/congestion and make all.

title: Verisimilitude + calibration: realistic intakes + moment matching
description: Add (1) realistic home-services task taxonomy and natural-language intake generation (standard form + messy free text + agent chat), (2) a lightweight moment-calibration harness for FieldSim v2 (targets: price, cancel rate, match rate, messages/inbox), and (3) regenerate all reports so the thesis still holds under calibrated, more realistic primitives.

comments.author: rohit
comments.text: Implemented verisimilitude + calibration. Added home-services task taxonomy + realistic intake samples (reports/intakes_latest/README.md). FieldSim v2 now outputs richer job/provider columns (task_id, budgets, complexity/weirdness, requirements, etc.) in reports/field_v2_latest/jobs.csv and providers.csv. Added moment-matching calibration harness + params overrides: reports/field_v2_calibration_latest/README.md + best_params.json; field_sim_v2 supports --params-json; make field-v2-calibrated writes reports/field_v2_calibrated_latest. Core thesis under FieldSim v2: AI×central×hard raises net welfare more than in easy (triple on net_welfare = +4.79, p=0.096 in reports/field_v2_latest/reg_net_welfare.md; sensitivity sweep median triple welfare >0 with 0.61 positive share in reports/field_v2_sensitivity_latest/README.md). All interface gates green (make all).

title: Docs: rename narrative heading
description: Rename the README narrative section headings to avoid the phrase 'Plain-English'.

comments.author: rohit

- Ran `make paper-bundle` and `make all`: PASS.

title: Experiment 2: delegated outreach agents + saturation congestion
description: Implement a realistic home-services marketplace context with capacity constraints and a saturation design for delegated outreach agents; generate tables + plots showing congestion externalities and optimal adoption.

comments.author: rohit
comments.text: Plan: (1) run interface gates (make format/check/test/llm-live) after recent changes; (2) run make congestion to generate saturation-design outputs + plots under reports/latest_congestion; (3) sanity-check verisimilitude and summarize findings (spillovers + welfare-max saturation) in README/table.

comments.author: rohit
comments.text: Completed. Ran make all + make congestion after calibrating delegated-outreach scenario (k_agent_per_day=10, provider_daily_response_cap=5) to surface saturation trade-off. Results written to reports/latest_congestion/ (README.md + congestion_saturation_{easy,hard}.md + fig_*_vs_saturation.svg). Key finding: hard category welfare peaks at saturation=0.25 (net_welfare≈0.296) then declines by saturation=1.0 (≈0.229) as messages/inbox/overload rise; easy category welfare is maximized at 0.0 and declines monotonically with saturation.

title: Housekeeping: remove @AGENTS.md; review money modeling
description: Remove duplicate @AGENTS.md and review barter_to_money work to decide if any additional monetary modeling is warranted; update docs/code and rerun gates.

comments.author: rohit
comments.text:
- Removed duplicated agent-instructions file: deleted `@AGENTS.md`; keep only `AGENTS.md`.
- Reviewed `strangeloopcanon/barter_to_money` (barter vs hub+token under bounded comms). Conclusion: no additional “token money” modeling needed here for the matchmaking thesis; the relevant analog is that prices can compress negotiation and we already model budgets/quotes.
- Added/ surfaced monetary outcomes where it matters: FieldSim v2 now writes `reg_provider_profit.*` and the paper bundle table includes the `provider_profit` triple (`reports/paper_latest/key_results.md`).
- Docs: root `README.md` now references the source paper PDF and notes money/prices live in `make field-v2`.
- Refreshed outputs: `make field-v2 paper-bundle`; quality gates: `make all` PASS.
